Reviews.Title: “Nice, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: bemoenk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a reasonable price. Large rooms, with access to free internet and a large multimedia-library via the flat-screen tv. Very comfortable bed. Note that the beds in double rooms are actually double-sized beds, and not just two single beds pushed together. The hotel is located on top of the Anhalter Bahnhof S-bahn stop, and just a few minutes walk from Potsdamer Platz.

Reviews.Title: “Almost in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not so far from Brandenburger Tor (25 min. walking), very near to Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn station but not on a breathtaking surrounding (is this really matter if you are there to visit the town and not to stay all day long in the hotel?), Suite Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz Hotel is a good choice for relaxation. (Are all Suite Novotel hotels the same? In Hamburg the room has exactly the same layout.)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: kiwijamie86
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located just a short walk from the Berlin wall and check point charley. The rooms were huge. The single beds were a little small but still had a good night sleep. Rooms are very quiet. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Between 6-11 they had free coffee, tea and mini muffins available, which is a great touch. Then throughout the day, there was a basket of croissants and bread rolls to help yourself to. A great hotel. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CDH18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Novotel Suite for five nights with two children, the suite gave us that extra space you always crave from a hotel room. The staff were polite and very helpful, the rooms clean, and the location on a bus route and underground station meant getting around Berlin was a breeze. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel, instead used the cafes at the close by tube stop. Wifi worked in the rooms, although not too strong a signal, but overall a great hotel, the location of one stop to Potsdammer was ideal, and the cafe bar opposite served a fantastic evening meal if you couldn't be bothered to go out. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samot_K_1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was really good, clean, very good location. I can recommend it to everybody

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: evandstace
Reviews.Content: The Suite Novotel is well located for sightseeing whilst in Berlin. Getting to the hotel from Berlin's Schonefeld airport takes around 50 minutes on the S and U Bahn train system. When you arrive at Schonefeld walk 400 meters to the station, it's there where you can purchase a ticket. The ticket price is €3, you need to ensure you get a zone ABC ticket. The train to Friedrichstrasse takes around 20 minutes, change here to an S Bahn train to Anhalter Banhof, the hotel is 50 meters from the station exit. The rooms in all Suite Hotels are exactly the same. Free WIFI and Movies are available although the login system for the WIFI is painful. The rooms are large and have both a bath and shower, although sometimes it feels like your in the cabin of a ship! The only negative points on the rooms is the lack of air conditioning, this means leaving the window open and subjecting yourself to the regular noise from behind the hotel ( it can be super loud on the weekend). The hotel has a very basic gym, a restaurant and bar. Breakfast is €12 and is not worth it. Free muffins and coffee/tea are available in the mornings which is a nice touch. The hotels location is perfect for exploring Berlin. The Topography of Terror ( a must visit ) is 5 minutes walk add another few minutes and you'll be at Checkpoint Charlie. For shopping and eating head to Potsdamer Platz, everything you need is in this area, shops,restaurants and bars! If you are after a well priced hotel with some of the extra's included in good location the Suite Novotel is a good choice in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: samlowry1972
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Suite Novotel four times for work during the Berlin Film Festival. The decor of the rooms is a little eccentric, but the rooms are very large and practical (including kettle and microwave), the hotel is well maintained and the staff are always helpful and attentive, and all English-speaking. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from Potsdamer Platz and Checkpoint Charlie, and also a walkable distance from the shops of Friedrichstrasse as well as tourist sights like Gendarmenmarkt, the Brandenburg Gate, Unter den Linden and the Holocaust Memorial. The location around the hotel isn't the most interesting in terms of bars, restaurants or nightlife, but the hotel is central enough that entertainments are only a u-bahn journey or taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: pspgmr6
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin last Jan 2012. It was just a weekend trip - Friday to Sunday, with our 3 small kids. We were given two connecting rooms. Hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. Room was nice, spacious and comfortable. It has a king size bed and a sofa. They also provides free internet connection and free movies. I also like their toilet ammenities. Though the soap in the shower is not enough and we have to get the soap dispenser from the bath tub. Unfortunately, after the housekeeping, the no refill was done on the soap dispenser on the shower and the other dispenser that we took from the tub was still on the shower floor. Room was not cleaned thoroughly when we came back on Saturday night. As for the restaurant, breakfast is nice though the pace is small if there is a big group tour. Luckily, we came in just a minute before a big group arrived and we were able to secure a place for us. The food is good even though there is just enough selections. Also, when the breakfast is already close, they provide snacks on the counter for free. They even sell some snacks and drinks on the area beside the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Large room with good location”
Reviews.Author: Amy_traveltheworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if your wanting an apartment style room with microwave,fridge,sink and large table to eat at. The room is very large, with a separate toilet from the shower and bath (Which are also separate from each other). Good location in a boring city (berlin). Service was average, was not bad but was no more than that of a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTimon
Reviews.Content: So great, so nice, so fantastic! Clean, friendly, great location and..... Will definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice choice for city break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The suites are spacious, bathroom had separate shower and bath with a second small room for the toilet. Kettle, small fridge and microwave lets you make a reasonable breakfast in the morning. Very close to the S-Bahn and short walk to Checkpoint Charlie area. Free internet very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Unwilling to fix a problem”
Reviews.Author: BonnieMax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Suites Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz Hotel during New Year eve. This hotel is very close to the Anhalter underground station and about 10 minute walk from Potzdamer Platz. They have an ash tray right outside the front door for smokers, which you have to walk through all the smoke to get into the hotel. Even though I booked this hotel in May and I am an AClub member, we were given room 431, a disable room with 2 single beds, 1 chair and not a very functional bathroom. We went straight down to the reception to see if we could changes rooms and they said they were full and to come back down tomorrow morning before 11 am and they would change rooms for us. Next morning we packed our bags and went down at 9 am and they said that we could not change rooms because they were fully booked and everybody checking on that day was families and they needed all the double rooms. So that meant that my wife and I were spending our wedding anniversary in separate beds. On the third night we finally changed rooms to 512, this was much better, 2 chairs so 2 people could sit down. The rooms were large, modern, clean and well set up. It had a large flat screen TV with movies and internet, telephone with free national calls, microwave, fridge, and kettle. This hotel is very well set up for the internet, if you have your own computer or you can use the ones in the lobby or on your TV all for free. The lifts seemed to take forever and were not handling the amount of guess staying at the hotel. We did not eat breakfast there, because we thought 13 euros was bit much and there are plenty of places to eat close by. We had a nice drink in the bar after getting back after the New Year’s celebrations. I’m not too sure if I would stay here again due to being messed around and the lack of wiliness from the staff to try and organize some type of compromise.

Reviews.Title: “good family sightseeing hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good budget hotel in the very centre of berlin,5 mins walk to potsdamer plaza.very helpful & pleasant staff 24hrs a day.rooms clean,well equiped & large enough for short weekend break for a family of 4.The buffet breakfast area can be slighty crowded when everybody arrives for breakfast at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, very clean and well designed”
Reviews.Author: linden-s
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and very cleverly designed with a lovely bathroom with full size bath and excellent powershower and a nice range of toiletries provided. Next to the bathroom was a small kitchenette area containing a sink, kettle, microwave and fridge with coffee/tea/sugar and powdered creamer (no milk) provided and replenished daily. On the other side of this was the loo with its own sink. Internet (both wired and wifi) is free and unlimited. There were English channels on the tv and a good selection of free English movies (as well as several other languages). Two plump pillows each on the bed, good soundproofing and blinds at the windows complete the upside. On the downside, the bed was the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in - the mattress was so hard I woke up several times during the night (we both did, and the other half usually sleeps anywhere!). One thing to bear in mind when visiting - the little kitchenette is useful, however only two paper cups are provided, no plates, spoons, knives or forks so if you plan a little room-based picnic be sure to take your own. It seems strange that they supply a microwave and no way to eat what you've heated up, but I'd stay there again very happily and take my own tools next time. If I could have a softer bed!

Reviews.Title: “City tour”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent room, big, big bathroom, free internet, free films, good breakfast, good location , 6 minutes walking to Postdamerplatz, check point Charlie, 1 min. Walking to S bahn station, payable parking at hotel, recomended hotel for city tour also for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Berlin Potsdamer Platz Suite Novotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located opposite Anhalter Bahnhof S-Bahn Station and a short walk from Potsdamer Platz. The location is pretty good, only a few minutes to The Brandenburg Gate and Unter den Linden. I have stayed here a few times and would say the value for money is very good and the rooms are large and clean. I would recomend this hotel if you want a decent location at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Christmas Travel”
Reviews.Author: Garfield38 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful place and the stay was made very comfortable by the hotel staff. Everything that is needed for a long enjoyable stay was included. Highly recommended for all the right reasons. Cosy room with free movies, internet and cable. Microwave and Electric kettle were nice thoughts also.

Reviews.Title: “smart choice for family journey”
Reviews.Author: robson71andy
Reviews.Content: Hotel's surroundings are not so interesting ,but location is very good in general. The S-bahn station is a few steps from the hotel entrance. Room was typical for Suite Novotel - spacious , very clean and modern furnished, equipped with electric kettle,fridge and microwave ( turntable wasn't rotating unfortunately ). Beds were comfortable . You'll get a free coffee and tea, one bottle of still water and typical bath amenities. I was trying to watch movie on demand using Suite media box ,but none of available films couldn't download . There is one thing I could really complain about - it was too hot in the room, airco was turned off in the winter time. The only way to reduce the temperature was the opening of the window- in this case, the traffic noise would not let me sleep. Staff were nice and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quite reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel's surroundings are not so interesting ,but location is very good in general. The S-bahn station is a few steps from the hotel entrance. Room was typical for Suite Novotel - spacious , very clean and modern furnished, equipped with electric kettle,fridge and microwave ( turntable wasn't rotating unfortunately ). Beds were comfortable . You'll get a free coffee and tea, one bottle of still water and typical bath amenities. I was trying to watch movie on demand using Suite media box ,but none of available films couldn't download . There is one thing I could really complain about - it was too hot in the room, airco was turned off in the winter time. The only way to reduce the temperature was the opening of the window- in this case, the traffic noise would not let me sleep. Staff were nice and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hip suite”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I loved the suite which comes with free wifi, move on demand and a huge room that is comfortable. Decor is hip and trendy. Definitely would recommend this hotel to my family and friends who visit Berlin. Thanks for making my stay such a memorable one. Cheers, June

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dg1812 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Suite Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz is in a great central location, it is within walking distance of many of the main attractions in central Berlin. Anhalter Banhof is only a few metres from the hotel, shoud you need to travel further afield. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean and comfortable. the facilities in the rooms are excellent, free internet access and many free films in english are available on the suitebox. The staff are oustandingly helpful, nothing is too much bother, they are friendly, quick to help and very efficient in resolving any requests that they are asked of them. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location , nearby a lot of touristic objectives and a S-bahn station ( Anhalter Bahnhof) from where you can start a lot of trips , friendly staff , a good report price- services. We certainly recomand this hotel for a holiday in Berlin .

Reviews.Title: “Berlin at premium location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location is very good with immediate access to the metro and only 10 to 15 min walk from the Sony Center, Checkpoint Charlie, Bradenbourg Gate etc... good parking, good breakfast... Nice, helpful personnel...Slow elevators but its only a four stories building

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MariahTK
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 6 times altogether. A simple but funky hotel. Price is always good. When you travel to Berlin NEVER EVER expect any friendliness or helpfulness (remember that Iron Curtain not to mention The Wall.....) but you may just be pleasantly surprised one day. Anyway back to this hotel - I love the walk up tp Potsdamer Platz passing a hotdog stand on the way.It takes 10 minutes. There are a good few sights right near bye e.g.Martin Gropius Bau, the SS Topography of Terror museum, Checkpoint Charlie. You could walk to the Brandenburg Gate in 25 minutes.Remember Berlin DOES NOT have an actual centre.The bus stops nearby bring you straight to West Berlin and the KU Damm and the fabulous KaDeWe.The U Bahn is just across the road. The rooms are basic but I love the microwave and kitchenette with fridge. There is an Aldi just around the corner-very practical indeed, especially in summer for cool drinks.When you stay here it is no frills but you are surely going to see the sights in Berlin and not the inside of a room???Head on up to the Adlon if you want luxury :-) If you are not in the centre of Berlin to eat at night (Maxmillians, Friedrichstr. 185-190) then there are a few small diner/gastro pubs nearby.Staff were always very pleasant and helpful to us here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location and value”
Reviews.Author: otj80
Reviews.Content: Hotel was new, clean and modern. The rooms decoration felt a bit plasticy. We had a room that could be divided in two separate rooms with light movable walls. Location is good, the hotel is near a train station and just a few blocks away from Potzdamer Platz. Breakfast was good and varied, but the breakfast room was too small. The hotel doesn't have enough elevators, had to wait for too long sometimes. Overall, this is a nice hotel and the value was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the best 3 star hotels I have stayed in. The location perfect for people using S and U bahn. The microwave in the room is very usable! I hope more suite hotels will be established in Europe by Accor

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location”
Reviews.Author: EuroFans Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a perfect location just a few blocks from Checkpoint Charlie, Topographie of Terror and Potsdamer Platz and the Sony Center. The hotel was clean, modern, and comfortable for a family of 4 with a double bed and 2 single beds. There was a separate bathroom for the shower, tub and sink, and then one for the toliet and a 2nd sink. My one complaint was the bathroom with the toliet smelled the whole time we were there. Other than that, I would definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again myself. The breakfast was a nice buffet with plenty to choose from including fresh eggs.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: pros: location is excellent for price, helpful front desk, rooms are functional, comfortable, quiet, refrigerator is small but adequate, several mini-markets within walking distance. multi-media system with free internet and free VOD movies (important since all tv content in Germany is dubbed). cons: expensive breakfast (considering you're staying here to save in first place), ambience not for couples on romantic getaway, no suitcase rack which remains on floor. overall: good for families and the budget concious.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and place, bad service”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Suite Novotel between 24th September until october 4th. The first stay (first 6 nights, until october 1st) was Ok even though the personal were not helpful. Cleaning could be better but overall the hotel was good. Rooms in the 5th floor. Then during 1st there was no room. Stayed on another location for that night but as the trade-off between quality and price were better in Suite novotel, went back. Unfortunately, not only were the staff again not nice, but the rooms were on the Erdgeschoss and not really good. Overall, lack of cleanliness and one of the rooms (we were 4) had noise due to the ventilation. We asked if we could move to another floor being the answer first that as we had communicating rooms the hotel was fully booked. When we said that it was the same (we never asked for communicating rooms), they said the room was fully booked and we could try next day. So then I asked for the ventilation to be checked and there was no help at all. Then I asked for a complaints book (Bescherdebuch) to get the answer that there is none and that I could leave a note on the room (?!). As I payed 99 Euros without breakfast for these rooms I can say that this is not cheap. Good points are: central, silent (good isolation if you close the windows), and free Internet access. Bad points are: unfriendly staff; lack of cleanliness; bad service; and DO try to get away from rooms on lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - large rooms”
Reviews.Author: BelTiti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located within walking distance of the Potsdamerplatz (with restaurants, shopping, etc) and the Checkpoint Chalie on Friedrichstrasse. A few S-Bahn stops and you're virtually everywhere in Berlin. The rooms are quite large and well equipped with seperate shower and bath, free internet (wifi or cable). The perfect place for both tourists and businessmen alike.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyPan
Reviews.Content: Good functional hotel in a great location. Convenient to Potsdammer Platz and the Brandenburg Gate. Reception staff were good. Excellent secure parking at a good price. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Berliners are friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Dianna W
Reviews.Content: My husband went to Berlin - I could not get the time off. He ran the Berlin Marathon. Stayed at the Suite Novotel Hotel and had this to say: "The reception on arrival was very efficient and helpful. The room was great - very spacious and clean. Modernistic and functional. If you go for the frills and cutie touches then this hotel might not be for you. Fabulous breakfast - if you ate all they supplied you wouldn't have to eat until the evening! The hotel is situated very close to most points of cultural interest and also to night life. Would definitely recommend this hotel to any traveller"

Reviews.Title: “Suite Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz, Central and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: hughcr
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just got back (23 Sept. 2011) after a 7 night stay. The whole experience was excellent, barring the lack of an evening restaurant. The room was quiet, comfortable, and had everything the modern traveler needed - fridge, microwave, coffee and tea, bath, shower, comfortable beds. It also has free wi-fi, and free cable access to the internet as well. Staff were consistently helpful, but Sebastian on the front desk/bar was a godsend - he really helped us understand the Berlin S and U-bahn system, a few times being able to tell us of easier routes. And always with a smile and a twinkle in his eye, regardless of the time or day! The only really downside was the lack of an evening hotel restaurant, but this was easily overcome with the variety of local restaurants - especially the Italian on the corner. The cafe/bar across the road was excellent for breakfast (and better value) Berlin itself was great - what you would expect of an historic cosmopolitan city. Day trips to Dresden and Leipzig are all manageable and relatively cheap on the very efficient and clean German Rail network. Germans seem to be a very misunderstood people - they do have a sense of Humor, and providing you spend a little energy to speak in German, the rewards are well worth it. Recommend the Hotel to everybody - business and pleasure! Hugh Creswell

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Rohit_CG
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for one night, and stayed at the Suite Novotel at Potsdamer Platz. The hotel is just about a 10min walk from Potsdamer Platz station, or else 1 min walk from Anhalter Bahnhof (S Bahn) station. Some good points:- 1. Helpful and courteous staff 2. Convenient location - close to Potsdamer Platz as well as Anhalter Bahnhof stations 3. Nice spacious rooms, very clean bathrooms. 4. Wifi was good Some not so good points:- 1. For the breakfast price I paid, I was expecting a better breakfast 2. There is no room service, neither does the hotel have a restaurant. I was kinda feeling not too good, and asked the reception if I could order something to eat, and to my surprise they didnt have room service. I would expect an all-suite hotel to have that Final Verdict:- I wouldnt mind coming back again as the staff were nice and the hotel is good too. Though I will be prepared to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All was good to stay except the location which was a bit away from main points. The staff was avergly good in attitude thiough they should imporve the communication with the guestes. Since i been flying diffent location and staying in diffrent hotels , i guess when you say suit Hotel , the rooms should be a bit more in space though the beds arrangment and other things provided within the room were good.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the comfort seeker”
Reviews.Author: Travelgul
Reviews.Content: Travelled sept 2011 w husband for vacation. First, they couldn't find out reservation. Luckily we had our confirmation. Second - No AC!!! We were told to open window and that there's no AC in the entire hotel. When asked for a fan, we were given one of those tiny desk fans without any power. I searched for other area hotels and checked out immediately. We were charged almost 60 euros for the 3 hours we were checked in. We shouldn't have been charged anything considering the inconvenience!!! But I understand. The hotel site should have a note to travellers about the lack of AC so they can decide if that's something they want to compromise on in exhange for free movies, and Internet (which the hotel Offers). Good location. Close to Berlin wall and Checkpoint Charlie. Just smelly stuffy no AC room.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here and as good as ever!”
Reviews.Author: Zundappzundapp
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the internet from the UK as I'd stayed here once before and it's location was great - just a short stroll to Checkpoint Charlie, the Sony Centre, the Die Welt Balloon and all the rest of Berlin's city centre attractions. It also has secure underground parking (12 Euros per day) which is a bonus in Berlin, especially when you're on a motorbike! It was just as before - large en-suite rooms with a fridge and microwave, rather like a very good cabin on a cruise ship. The beds were comfy and clean, the room was spotless and the reception staff all spoke flawless English. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, it didn't look very good value, but within a three-four minute stroll there a lots of places which do buffet breakfasts every morning for around 7.50 Euros. Next time in Berlin, I'll be staying again in the Suite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Allan_Wotherspoon
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin from August 30 to September 5, 2011 and stayed here. The rooms are large and comfortable, with both a tub and separate shower. A microwaveand small fridge are in the room as well. The bed was comfortable and cozy. Wired internet access was included. Wireless access (free as well) was also available, but signal strength was marginal and logging in each time was a bit of a pain, especially on a smartphone. Wired access was quick and easy though. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel It was clean and comfortable and in a good location. Be advised that although it is called the Suite Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz, it is actually about a 5 minute walk from the Potsdamer Platz. The neighbourhood felt safe and I didn't have any qualms about being out walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money. The rooms were great and it was central to anything in Berlin ie. Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall, Reichstag, and only as bus from central Berlin and the Berlin Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Soph1997
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Berlin, I travelled with my family. This Hotel is basically what you would expect of a "Novotel", but, the rooms are what you would expect of a "Suite" hotel. Good points about the hotel: - It is a nice sized room - Very Modern rooms and lobby - Clean Hotel - Comfortable Hotel - Has a mini-fridge in the room - Nice breakfast - The location is excellent. It was convenient that we had a station for the S bahn one minute away from the Hotel. A few bad points are: - When we arrived the spare duvet and pillow did not have cases and there was supposed to be two extra duvets and pillows but there was only one and it took a while for these to arrive. - The air conditioning in the rooms don't work very well, our room got very hot. Tips: -If you get an ABC welcome card/train ticket (we got our tickets for 72 hours) you have unlimited travel for on the buses and trains. We found that this was vital by the third day because we used it so much. - There is an Aldi supermarket which is a 2 minute walk away. Buy snacks and drinks there and put them in your mini-fridge, it is cheaper than the snacks in the hotel. - Some attractions in Berlin you have to book as far up to a week in advance. If there is anything you wish to do, research when you have to book first. - Hit the popular places, museums and attractions early in the morning, come back to the Hotel for a rest for an hour or to, then go shopping. We found that we could do a lol more things in Berlin when we did this for the first 2 days. - Do not go to the Legoland discovery center if your child is older than 8. We visited it and it cost us 50 euros to go in. We did and we felt like it was a waste of money for what we paid for. It is basically only little play areas and two rides. Don't go if you are older then 8 or if your child is really into Lego. Thanks for reading my review, I recommend going to this Hotel if you want to see a lot of Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: yorkuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Aug 2011 Rooms clean and staff helpful Room included fridge and microwave (including kettle coffee and teas) Next to Anhlater Banhoff for convenience Also close to Potsdammer Plaz and Museums Excellent Bike rentals nearby Good local places for eats and drinks

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: hertstraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a two night, three day break in mid August. It was our first trip to Berlin We arrived at the hotel just after 11am. Expecting to wait it was a pleasure to find our room was ready. I have stayed at suitehotel in France so no surprises with the room. It is functional and fits the bill. It took less than 1 hour from Schoenefeld airport with one change. I am sure it would be quicker if you had mastered the transit system before. Good Italian resturant next door good food and good value. The S Bahn is just steps from the front door. It is also on many bus routes. A little further to an Aldi supermarket. (Trader Joe's in the US). I could not get the WI FI to work on my I phone, but may that's me. We arrived back on the second day to find house keeping had not visited the room. We had breakfast one morning. 26euro for a family of four. Good choice and nice coffee. As we had an evening flight on the day we departed. The hotel looked after our bags after we checked out until we collected around 7pm. I found the staff pleasant and attentive. My only gripe was the A/C did not work. It was around 65f 19C outside but the room did get very warm. I would stay here again.With the S Bahn next door its easy to get around. You can walk to Potsdamer Platz in 5 mins. Never felt unsafe at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Not for runners!”
Reviews.Author: Thordis P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice in many ways, location and bed room was spacious and well equipped. However, one of the reasons I decided to stay there was because it had a fitness centre. When I went there to visit it I got very disappointed, small with no treadmill, only a bicycle and a couple of other things so I had to hit the road in the rain where I did not know my way around. On the morning of the last day the family decided to visit the fitness centre together, I was going to get some work out on the bike. As it turned out then we could not because of linen had been stored in there and they had no intentions of having it moved untill in the evening! So if you are looking for a hotel with fitness facilities dont go for this one!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting variant on the Novotel Brand”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Rooms and facilities in the rooms very good and clean. Nice to have a separate good size shower and bath. Room divider an interesting capability. Microwave and fridge however nothing to use it with and no crockery or cutlery in the rooms. TV difficult to see because of angle from either the bed or work area. Let down by capacity of breakfast area and inadequate provision of bread products and coffee making capacity with queues and delays. Free wireless and wired internet although wireless not terribly fast.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: sparkinthedark221 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As the hotel name suggests, you get a suite rather than just a standard bedroom - and very nice it was too. The suite in this obviously new and modern hotel was spacious with a large double bed, a comfortable sofa bed, a large table / desk with a couple of chairs, two separate wardrobe areas and a third area with shelves and a safe . The toilet (with hand basin) was separate to the main bathroom, which featured a full size basin, a huge bath with a shower attachment for washing hair etc and a separate shower cubicle. Toiletries such as shower gel, shower cap etc were provided as was a small fridge, a kettle and a microwave together with a selection of teabags and coffee sachets. Unlike a lot of hotels, the level of lighting was good making it possible to read comfortably late at night. The wall mounted flat screen TV could also apparently be used to access the internet but unfortunately the instructions provided for using the Suite Box were cursory and I could not work out which button on the mini keyboard was the enter/return one. Fortunately, a couple of PCs, with normal keyboards, were also provided in the foyer, making it possible to get a short internet fix each day. There was generally a lack of information about both the room and hotel services - things like the timing for breakfast, the location of the laundry room, the fact that the room had a pull out room divider etc etc The hotel was in an easy to get to location, being right next to the Anhalter Bahnhof station on the S Bahn system and only one S Bahn stop (or a short bus ride) from Potsdammer Platz and with easy access to all other parts of the city. There were also restaurants and supermarkets only a few minutes walk away. My room was at the back of the building and the downside to this was the level of noise from people visiting the building next door in the evenings and also early in the morning on the day when the bins were emptied, meaning disturbed sleep . Whilst I was generally happy with the hotel, some aspects of the housekeeping were sloppy, which you do not expect in a German hotel. The shower gel in the shower cubicle was allowed to become totally empty so that I had to drip across the bathoom to find something else with which to wash and a couple of the light bulbs were not working and were not replaced. Not things I would waste time complaining about at reception but irritating nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Up to the expected standard, amusing stay for the family. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Faris010
Reviews.Content: Clean, quite, large family rooms with comfortable xtra beds, the kids enjoyed the free films. Close to many attractions, u can reach most by walkig. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place in good area”
Reviews.Author: Globtrotter3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in quite area outside Potsdamer Platz. Hotel is build in the Accor hotel complex so you have the variety of the hotels here like Ibis and Etap as well. The hotel was OK even thought at the time of my arrival there were only smoking rooms available or for handicap people. The room was big and clean. It is very easy to park your car outside the hotel so you can save on parking fees. The hotel is average fine no reason to be excited no reason to complain. For my next Berlin trip I would search for another hotel anyway. When I was there it was extremely warm in the night as they only had winter blankets. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown Berlin - within walking distance to all historic sights”
Reviews.Author: TourEiffelUSA
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel in Berlin - you can walk to all sites from there including Checkpoint Charlie. Spacious room for a family of 4 - which is a big plus when traveling in Europe - not that many hotel can accommodate 4 pple in the same room! A ++ staff very friendly and full of advise regarding Berlin tourist activities- they gave us milk for free for my 2 kids - we loved that friendly gesture (the room has a microwave and a mini fridge) - I speak German so I think they appreciated it :). It had indoor parking (for a fee). would recommend - great pricing too!

Reviews.Title: “A View from Above”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a splendid hotel, with easy access to the city centre and transport links. The staff are friendly and helpful-and what a good thing their English is better than my German. I suppose I should have written this in German!

Reviews.Title: “Very large room, good location. Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: MikeAnnArbor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Novotel for five nights. The rooms are very large and well equipped for business travel - desk, office chair, internet, etc. The beds are firm but comfortable and there is a separate couch that can be used as a bed. Everything was spotless. I think there are free local calls from the room. Though they advertise their rooms as a kitchenette, there is only a microwave and a refrigerator. No plates or utensils are available. I had trouble finding paper plates and plastic utensils in the neighborhood, even though there are two discount supermarkets within two blocks. Novotel has designed a room which makes very efficient use of a lot of space, e.g. there is a room divider that can separate the sleeping and working area. There are separate rooms for the toilet with washbasin (at the room entrance) and the bathing area which included a shower, washbasin and separate bathtub (opposite the sleeping area). The bathing area has only swinging double bar style doors. The hotel staff were cordial but did not go out of their way to help. For example, when I called down to the desk to get some information, I was told I could find it on the internet. Another time they looked up a telephone number number of the place where I wanted to get opening times but did not offer to call for me. I stood at the desk and tried to reach the number using my American cell phone and got a recording in German. I called again and handed it to the clerk who missed the message. Only then did he call on the hotel phone. The hotel is about a 4 block walk to Potsdamer Platz but there is a subway entrance to Berlins outstanding public transportation system right on the corner. For example, you can reach the museum island in less than 20 minutes. A few other features that were unique are free four hour car loans (a 400 Euro damage deposit is required), free Thursday neck massages for guests staying more than a certain number of days etc. This hotel would be ideal if your are coming to Berlin for business, given the workspace and internet. This is a 3 star utilitarian hotel but very nice. It is an excellent value for money. The hotel is part of the Accorhotels.com group, (Novotel, Ibis, Mercure, Sofitel, etc.) where you can expect quality and high value. I found that if you join for free at http://www.a-club.com/en/ you can make unrestricted reservations without entering credit card information.

Reviews.Title: “The Johnsons in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great city. To make the most of your stay we suggest you utilise the S & U Bahns which are clean, cheap and convinient. For a meal or night cap visit the Solar Bar situated directly behind the hotel. It's 12th flooor setting will allow you to enjoy great views of the city whilst taking your refreshments.

Reviews.Title: “viaggio a Berlino”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent position, wonderful rooms, breakfast expensive and not worth to buy considering the excellent german restaurant located across the street, customer service sufficient but not always prepared, lack of an easily accessible wifi connection

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect but hot as hell”
Reviews.Author: chuvak
Reviews.Content: The Suite Novotel is a 3 minute walk from the Anhalter Bahnhoff metro station, and also has a bus stop (near the entrance to the metro) for the bus that goes to the main train station. It is centrally located - 10-15 minute walk to the Jewish Museum and Checkpoint Charlie. Of course, Potsdamer Platz is also close. You get free tea and instant coffee in your room, some rooms include a nice looking breakfast, and the non-inclusive rooms get coffee and some cake freely available in the morning. The hotel has free wifi, as well as two computers for guest use in the lobby that were never busy. It even has a small but well-equipped fitness room with two elliptical machines and a nautilus machine. Our room was HUGE for Europe with separate toilet and bathrooms, a double bed that was pretty comfortable (not soft, more the standard IKEA mattress). The staff is friendly and mostly efficient. Our only big complaint was that the AC didn't work and the floor we were on, as well as our room, was like a furnace. The hallway outside of our room on the 6th floor was a constant 90 degrees F, and inside of the room was not much better, and this was over a weekend that was cold and rainy outside. I think the heat was still on in the hotel... in June. Anyway, it was fine if we left the windows open, but the sound of people drinking, fighting and arguing in the alley outside kept us up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: 4 nights stay in this hotel in May 2011. A bit disappointing overall. Location is practical with the S-Bahn, even though it's not Potsdamer Platz, despite the hotel name. Prices were ok also, 100€ including breakfast. However several drawbacks. Huge groups everyday, which made having breakfast a daily fight. I preferred t skip breakfast in the end... Bed was ok but bathroom and toilets felt really cheap with plastic everywhere and shampoo dispenser fixed to the wall. I assume overall it's ok if you prefer value to quality.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: debrajo2127 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: nothing fancy but clean and in a safe area. on an "accor property" strip as etap and ibis on same street. the bistro across the street has good food and friendly service. market around the corner open until 8pm for snacks and beverages as your room has fridge and micro. the hotel has breakast but seemed expensive, free coffee and cake each morning. easy walking distance to checkpoint charlie (and starbucks & mcdonalds) as well as the jewish museum). the bus stop and metro is on the corner. as for the room, the shower, sink bathtub is one "room", the toilet and sink is separate, and the micro and fridge and yet another little sink is in the main part of the room. trundle bed (single) under main bed. there is a bench type couch as well as table and chairs. anyone who has stayed at an ibis and an etap, its like the best features of both, plus a litte more. PLUS..maybe because i booked many so early, i don't know but my room was 72 euro a night and both ibis and etap were 88 .. anyway, i am returning to Berlin in the spring and will stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value near Potsdamer Platz”
Reviews.Author: BensMom1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 3 children (ages 10, 6 and 5) over Memorial Day weekend. It is conveniently located (steps from the Anhalter Bahnhof train station, and walking distance to Potsdamer Platz) and a great value. I slept with one child in the double bed, one was on the daybed/sofa and another child was in a trundle bed. It's pretty difficult to find a hotel room that accomodates 4 people, but we found this room both clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. Some people complained that the breakfast was expensive, but kids eat free, so with 3 kids the breakfast is a steal! I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, could improve service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for several days and was overall very pleased. Its best points are its great location and the excellent rooms, as well as a great selection of breakfast items. On the downside, the service could be improved. For instance I wasn't asked if I was ok to be in a smoking room and once I realized that I had been put into a stuffy smoking, I had to request to be put into a different one. In addition, the personnel never greeted me personally, which I am accustomed to by other Novotel locations, consequently, it was a somewhat impersonal experience. Also, the hotel due to its great location seems to attract a lot of nightlife tourists so a room close to the elevator like mine will tend to get noisy, Overall recommended but not flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: DFBelfast
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for exploring all the major tourist sites of Berlin. The interesting Topography of Terror is across the road, Checkpoint Charlie is round the corner and Unter den Linden (the main street with the Brandenburg Gate on one end and Museum Island on the other) is approx 15 minutes walking distance or 3 minutes on the S-bahn. The rooms are more than adequate for a city break, ours was clean, spacious and reasonably comfortable although this depends on your taste of hardish beds and thin pillows. So if you want luxury probably give it a miss but be prepared to pay much more. The breakfast buffet is extremely good and sets you up for the day. Top Tip: For a fantastic view over Berlin head to Solar bar which is located at the top of the office block behind the hotel. Much higher than the Berlin Dom and with the money saved you can have a cocktail and watch the sun set over Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: shope11
Reviews.Content: Room was modern and clean. Some issues with internet access in the room, but not in the lobby. Amazing breakfast and very friendly staff. Good central location to many sites and to public transportation

Reviews.Title: “Some good and some not so good things”
Reviews.Author: KariJazz
Reviews.Content: Overall very happy with our stay here, it is a nice hotel in a good location right next to a metro station. The room was generally very clean but the toilet smelt quite bad, the bathroom and toilet was a bit of a strange construction- seemed to be like a plastic pod put into the room. The bathroom doesn't offer much privacy due to the 'saloon doors' so I would only share a room with people I know well. There was quite a lot of noise from the road outside and the room got really stuffy at night so we had to have the window open- luckily I brought ear plugs. Aside from that the room was well equipped and internet and movies free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Decent property”
Reviews.Author: DSA1965
Reviews.Content: Good value for money hotel. Good convenient location. The rooms were spacious and large. The breakfast spread was quite good. It isn't a fancy hotel, but a simple limited frills hotel. No in-room iron (which was a bit of a pain)

Reviews.Title: “Decent base, good connections”
Reviews.Author: walkingphil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a short break, tempted by a special offer. The first thing to be said is that access is very easy: the Analter Bahnhof S-bahn station is across the road and connects you to the whole of Berlin within one change. The immediate area is rather anonymous but the grandiosely modern Potsdamerplatz is about ten minutes walk away.The suites are quite spacious with a sitting area with sofa and table/desk, and a mini-kitchen with microwave, kettle and fridge. Design is rather naff-modern and plastic but tolerable. Beds may be hard for some tastes. We appreciated being able to make a drink or snack - or even a full microwave meal one evening when we got in feeling shattered. There's a Netto store a few minutes away down Anhalterstrasse and then left, with cheap food and even cheaper beer.There was no crockery or cutlery in the room except for cups but you can get plates and cutlery in the breakfast area and even bread if you are lucky! Just ask. Breakfast was included in our deal and was fine - plenty of choice including hot items. If you are room only better deals can be found all round Berlin and possibly in the cafe-bar across the road. One further point to note is that one of the longest remaining stretches of the Berlin Wall is about five minutes walk away, just along from the Netto store. Checkpoint Charlie is about ten minutes walk further on.

Reviews.Title: “The Bed is hard but the staff are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TheNo1Director
Reviews.Content: The beds are hard at this hotel however we experienced this over europe (may be a europe standard) Staff were wonderful and as Accor Club members we were welcomed with a Christmas gift Breakfast is great and location in good very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “almost ruined the weekend”
Reviews.Author: Quintus95
Reviews.Content: stayed over the weekend. the hotel is kind of funny, colourful rooms and the location is central but still quiet. but those beds!!! rock hard, and really, how fun can it be in berlin if one doesn´t sleep three nights in a row...?

Reviews.Title: “Just the BEST CHOICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simboloa
Reviews.Content: I spent two days in this hotel and it was wonderful!!!! big room, big bathroom with shower and bath....a lot of movies...all inclusive!!! There was a free coffee corner with a deliciuous cake... Don't exitate...book it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price at the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Earthnor
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in end of august, prebooked the hotel in june. Thanks to beeing close to anhalter s-bahn, its real easy to get from Schönefeld, and just a 5 minutes walk from the subway, your checked in. The room is as someone mentioned modular, with toilet/bathtub/shower/small kitchen combined. It's made of plastic, but still works great and looks new and fresh. If you don't have a laptop or PC with you there is still posibilities to surf the web, as the TV in the rooms have internet/PC capabilites via a small box which i think is linux based, coupled to a small wireless keyboard in the room. Also there is a great movieselection included, no extra charge! There is also cabled RJ45 jack in the room aswell Wi-Fi easy accessable. The rooms and hotel look very modern, and in the bottom floor there is a italian restaurant, although i didn't check it out during my stay. There is also a shop inside the hotel on the bottom floor that is open 24/7 with small snack and drinks. We had a room on 5th floor, and heard little to the traffic down on the street below that had alot of traffic during the day. With the windows closed the citysounds was totally shut out, excellent soundproofing, but the A/C could've been better, and did not chill enough during the night. From Anhalter you can get to friedrichstrasse bahnhof, where you can reach almost entire Berlin. From Anhalter you have also easy access to Tempelhof, Gesundbrünnen.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel with EXCELLENT location”
Reviews.Author: volvogirl2003
Reviews.Content: We were spending two nights in Berlin and wanted to stay in or near the Potsdamer Platz area. Suite Novotel was well-priced (higher due to marathon this weekend), and the rooms were extremely spacious and offered some unique amenities - mini-fridge, microwave, couch, and desk area. The furnishings were modern and appear fairly new. The bathroom is... unique - it appears to be a modular unit that was installed in the room - mostly plastic, but on the positive, it had both tub and shower and separate WC (a rarity in Europe!) Covered parking is terrific and it's located across the street from Anhalter Bhf stop on the S-Bahn (only a few stops from Alexanderplatz). Breakfast is pricey, but they provide free coffee (kaffee), tea (tee), and some type of pastry in the lobby. The only downside (and this is a very American criticism) is that they do not allow the air conditioning to run if the temperature falls below 20 degrees Celsius. If you're here during a transitional season, that means the A/C can run during the day, but will shut off at night. This can cause some uncomfortably hot sleep and because our room overlooked a noisy road, it was unpleasant to sleep with the windows open. I don't see that this is a problem all the time and having A/C is a luxury, but if that does matter to you, beware! One other note - some floors allow smoking. We were in room 202 - a smoking room, but I have to say the room did NOT smell smoky at all which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great layout & amenities”
Reviews.Author: schmango
Reviews.Content: This hotel suite was great, the room was very spacious and the little kitchenette with the bar fridge makes good for making your own breakfasts and lunches to save cash for the fun things. Admittedly by day 7, the hardness of the matress nearly lead to chiropractic work. The air conditioning also seemed to stop halfway through the night and if you opened the windows and are on a low level you cannot sleep with so much traffic noise. All in all, a good hotel for 2-3 nights maximum. The mattress won't allow your body much more. Free wifi was a huge bonus though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: bronniks
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Suitehotel during our first visit to Berlin. We got off at Brandenburger Tor and reached the hotel in 15-20 min on foot from there. So it's easy to find. Check-in took 1 min and we got exactly the same room we booked - with double bed and sofa. Unlike many european hotels room was spacious and comfortable. The most pleasant thing is that you can actually divide a suite onto two different areas - for sleeping and working. Also there is a kitchen area whic includes microwave-oven, kettle and fridge. Coffee/tea facilities are provided. The toilet and bathroom are separated from each other but for me it's even better. Besides, there is a small sink in toilet room for washing hands. In the bathroom there are shower, bath, sink and hairdryer. It's definitely not luxury place to stay, but it is very functional, safe and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy rooms, good location, free internet”
Reviews.Author: as530
Reviews.Content: Free internet on room TV (but cumbersome system). Great rooms with nice design & separate seating area and sofa. Amazing value. If I came again I'd stay here, without question. Oh, and a great pub-cafe right opposite serving good food at all times of day

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the size of room”
Reviews.Author: HHHYYY
Reviews.Content: The room we stay had a king size bed and sofa bed. It was a little interesting. Room was large so there was a divider in a room to separate bed/ bath area from table, chairs and toilet area. So if you need some privacy or want to nap during a day, it might help. Its bathroom is separated from toilet. Bathroom has shower booth and bathtub separately. As some other mentioned on their review, there is no door to close for the bathroom. There are doors to push open but it is not lockable. There is a safe and fridge in a room. Also cable/wifi free internet connection. 10min walk from Potsdamer Platz. Few min. to the closest tube station. You can walk to Check point Charlie and other tourist spots. (if you like to walk) There are many buses running in the area. Very convenient to go to the main station(Hbf). Bus stop is 30 sec (not even) from the hotel and it takes you the station in 10min(or less). There are some restaurants and bars around but very limited. You should go to Potsdamer Platz to have more choices in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveler21
Reviews.Content: My wife & I were meant to fly out to Venice when Easyjet went on strike & cancelled our plane. We jumped online and found a good rate for this hotel, so booked it. We packed our suitcases & walked over the two blocks from our current hotel to this one. We were pleasantly surprised. Firstly the location is excellent. Where we were staying (Winters Hotel) was basically on-top of the monuments, the problem was there wasn't anything else around it. This hotel however has two supermarkets, a pharmacy, a bar & a restaurant within 100m's of it. This made life a lot more pleasant in the evenings when we just wanted to pop out to eat & hit the sack. To make things even better, the hotel checked us in immediately (9am) so we could get rid of our luggage & relax. The room is well appointed with TV, free internet, mini-bar fridge and more. The TV/internet systems are connected so you can use the TV if you want for web surfing. The toilet/shower section feels similar to those in a caravan or plane. It's a large fiberglass-style section that (for lack of a better explanation) has been 'added' to the room. In saying that it was extremely clean and had a huge shower & bath in it, you will forget it's not tiled when you sit in a bath that size. The only reason I mention this at all is it may not suite some people, but as I said it is so clean & spacious I thought it was great. There are also 2x computers with printers in the lobby for free use. The only thing we didn't like was the doors to the bathroom aren't solid, but don't worry they are for the toilet. Also the hallways were really hot for some reason, we had to leave our windows open constantly to keep the temperature down. Overall we were extremely impressed by this hotel & wish we'd gone there to start with. Oh & FYI they serve coffee & cake in the morning for free for those who don't need a big breakfast, but it's nothing more then that.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Hotel Berlin: Pleasant Hotel with setbacks”
Reviews.Author: Toemaarjongens
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a perfect place of Berlin: Mitte. Just a few steps from the S-bahn, few minutes walk to the Topography of Terror and Checkpoint Charlie. Everything is within reach. Easy to find breakfast places in the neigbourhood (much cheaper and better value) and perfect diner 2 streets across (StadtKlaus: go there!) We had 2 children with us: 9 and 15 years old and stayed in a family room which was large enough. Convenient, well laid out room and beds can be separated with a flexible curtain. One problem: the room is too warm and the matresses are pretty hard. During day windows can be open, but not at night: the traffic will wake you up. Matrasses can get used to, but not the warmth. Airco does not cool. Only choice is to turn the airco off but it does not cool down really. Facilities are fine: free internet in room and at lobby, internet tv and radio, separate toilet from shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value - but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: canadabaerchen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in Berlin to celebrate the begin of the New Year 2010. That is about the busiest time in the city and hotels are booked to capacity everywhere. And most hiked their prices to a level beyond what we had planned to spend. Suitehotel Potsdamer Platz did offer us an affordable alternative. Price and location won us over. Situated right next to the S-Bahn station Anhalter Bahnhof it provided excellent transportation links. Potsdamer Platz is a 10 minute walk away, Brandenburger Tor maybe 15 minutes. Well, on New Years day at about 1 am it did take a bit longer ... Even during a noisy night like that our hotel room was very quiet. Service was very friendly. The front desk was always there to help and answer our questions no matter how busy the fully booked hotel kept them. As we arrived without luggage (different story ...) they were very quick in notifying us promptly when it finally did make it there - one by one. The room had a decent size though a bit tight for a family of 4. I suited us very well that toilet and sink/shower were in separate rooms which allowed us to get out of there to explore the city as fast as possible without waiting for a couple of teenage girls lining up for the bathroom. The beds were very hard, though. I don't like soft mattraces but this was too hard for me. Our reservation was for 4 people, yet, only 2 glasses were provided in the bathroom. I did get 2 additional ones from the bar. However, none of the glasses was every cleaned during our 4 night stay. There are two computers in the lobby for public use. We would have preferred wireless internet which was not available. This hotel provides a decent value but don't expect too much in amenities or atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A little like a big Ibis, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Wiener Sänger
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed was that the WC was tiny, like a railway car one, and separate from the average sized washbasin, shower and tub room. Perhaps this is why they call it a Suite .. there are technically 3 rooms! There is an Ibis next door, with a restaurant called "Café Hopfen Malz". The ruins of the Anhalter Bahnhof station are just across the street, Potsdamer Platz itself is 10 minutes walk (one S-bahn stop), and the Brandenburg gate is a few minutes from that. The hotel is very ideally placed to see the Checkpoint Charlie tourist attraction and museum (does everyone know that it IS only a tourist attraction?). and we did this just before checking out. The hotel is decent value only because of the location, you can expect to spend much more in this central area. There are some good leaflets in the lobby too.

Reviews.Title: “Wise choice”
Reviews.Author: pablo1827
Reviews.Content: Just back after a 4 night stay at this hotel and enjoyed it very much. Hotel is ultra clean the staff are very nice and friendly. Free coffee on offer each morning no need to pay the 11e for a breakfast as its cheaper to eat out once you leave the hotel. There is a Netto and an Aldi just around the corner. We didnt eat in the room but the mircowave was there along with a kettle and fridge. Its only a 10min walk to Potsdamer Platz and 15min to Checkpoint Charlie. We packed so much into our tour and it was nice to return home at night. The tv was great we could listen to radio 2 or watch Sky news or watch a film on demand. Free internet in reception and if you want request a keybord and and access internet through this magic tv. Ladies I would not advise you to depend on the hairdryer as its poor so take your own. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would also return to it for a holiday again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zsm
Reviews.Content: Convenient Location.Excellent service,Comfortable Rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and location”
Reviews.Author: sjkv82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so easy to find, close to so many different sights and with an easy commute to others. Check-in was so easy and cannot say enough good things about the rooms, amentiies within were fabulous considering the price! Loved being able to split the room into 2 different spaces, made it feel more than a hotel! Only down side is that there is a kettle and fridge but no cutlery, ie spoon for stirring tea or eating a yoghurt.... But if thats the only problem you encounter then its hard to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Practical hotel helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: geoffwellard
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located in the centre of Berlin. Staff were more friendly and helpful than the average big city centre hotel and proved to be very prepared to provide us with all the information we needed - which was a lot considering we had left home without a guidebook - local knowledge always the best! Rooms were clean and all efficient in what turned out to be a good choice venue for exploring a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - don't go there if you have the choice”
Reviews.Author: piaccere
Reviews.Content: Just horrible - i actually don't know how this hotel is still in business. I went for a long weekend, and booked directly from accor, requesting a non-smoking room. I had to pay at the reservation moment because it was a deal, but so far nothing wrong - seemed like a quite good deal, considering the reviews here. 1. Arrival: we were welcomed as if it was a favor they were doing to us. 2. At check in: despite having PAID for a non-smoking room, we were given a smoking room. Quoting the receptionist: " No, that's not how it works. You WISHED for a non-smoking room, but we don't have it. So now, deal with it." I was shocked and speechless. I've PAID for a non smoking room - if you told me you didn't have it, i would have stayed in another place. Besides, it was after 10pm, we were tired and still needed to have dinner. 3. First room: The room was stinking - not only like cigarettes, but also like rotten, there were hairs in the towels, horrible. 4. We went back to the reception. After arguing for another half an hour, finally she said that the next day we could change. We opened all the windows, but the smell wouldn't go away. None of us could sleep. 5. I would expect that after such occurrences they would simply change our luggage to a clean, non stinking room. Again, it was only my wish. So we went down to confirm the approach - but that was not in their scope. So we went to pick our luggage and... surprise - we had to wait half an hour for the lady to come around and store our luggage - after all, in her eyes she was mercifully doing us a favor. 6. The next room was not stinking, but was not clean neither. The two glasses in the toilet were dirty from the previous person (and remained like this for the entire stay); hairs around the place, they did not clear properly any of the 2 nights we stayed in the non-smoking room. so... in short: service: don't expect any - be pleased that you are allowed to stay there (unbelievable) cleanliness: ops... don't expect it. location: not my favorite spot in Berlin, but it's not the worse - you have an S-bahn station at your doorstep. rooms: ugly, small, dirty Notes: - They claim to have a hair dryer in the room. Well, i'm afraid you will find something that they want you to think is a hair dryer. It does not dry any hair, but maybe your hands if you have enough patience. - after seeing all the hairs in the clean towels and beds the first day, we decided not to have breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: xxpita
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in late April. All the staff were friendly, breakfast was a wide selection, fresh and more than adequate. Seating for breakfast was a little quirky, but we enjoyed it. Great location near Potsdamer Platz. Only complaint is the beds. Hardest we slept on ever. Definitely recommend they replace them. Otherwise, would visit here again. Parkign in secure garage was a definite plus, and reasonably priced. Al in all, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ninnytendo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Suitehotel and we really enjoyed it. The location is superb, 5 minutes from Postdamer Platz, 15-20 to the Brandenburg Gate and 10 to Checkpoint Charlie. The room was quite a good size and we had a double and single bed, which could be turned into a sofa with the large cushions provided. The best thing was having a fridge and microwave in the room. We did not have the hotel's breakfast and we went to the Aldi supermarket behind the hotel and bought everything we needed to prepare our own. Also, the hotel provides a complimentary coffee and pastry every morning, which is not bad. The hotel has 2 computers in the lobby where you can connect to the internet if you wish. However, you can also request to have a small wireless keyboard which you can use from the room's TV to access the net. They will charge you a 50 euro deposit for it which is fully refundable when you return it. You also have a wide choice of movies to watch in the room as well... I would definitely recommend this hotel as it was clean and very well located, but the beds were indeed hard. I'll stay here again if I come back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good, but not fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: silversus
Reviews.Content: The beds are very hard, our backs where sore every morning. The beds are made from a wooden plate and a matress! Breakfast is poor for 13 euro per person and you are seated in sofas or on a bar desk. Not appropriate for children. The service is not very friendly, none of the staffs are greeting you on the hallways or when entering the "restaurant area", a goodmorning would have been nice! We stayed over easter for 6 nights, but we won't be repeat guests. Location is perfect, everything worth seeing in Berlin is within walking distance. Hotel has Free pay TV - which is great, but the fitness room was small and where often used as storage for luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: rankfussa
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights in this hotel. I made the reservation by internet, and used the rate Hot Deals. (Paid by credit card). I had no problems with the reservation made earlier by the internet. Easy way and fast to booking Accor Hotels. Rates is very resonable with the hotel. Breakfast is good, but cost is high. Excelent Location. Best base in Berlin. Close to everything: Sony Center, Mall, Holocausto Momorial. Metro its close too. Safe area. Parking is inside the Hotel. I will stay again here. Very good cleaning of the room. Staff polite and speak English fluently. Pleasant Stay. I loved stay in SuiteHotel in Berlin and Hanover. Best choice. Very Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Strong, positive recommendation! Can't wait to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Middle_East_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I very highly recommend this hotel. Everything about it suited us -- location, condition, decor, service. As others have commented, the hotel seems very new, and the rooms are large, colorful, and nicely decorated. The bathrooms are great -- the toilet is in a separate enclosed area from the shower and bathtub (yes, there are both -- and they are separate and large), which is convenient for a large group staying in one room. Parking is available for 10 euros a day -- which includes in and out privileges. The parking lot is shared with the nearby Accor Hotels (Etap and Ibis). I agree with the other commenters that the breakfast is the worst part of the experience. We only tried it once, and we wouldn't recommend it. The breakfast area has a sterile, hospital-canteen look, and much of the food does come in little plastic containers. I think they have given into pressure and offered some items "out in the open," such as powdered scrambled eggs served out of a warming tray, but it seems like an afterthought. It's better to go next door to the Ibis, which has a 10 Euro breakfast buffet, or the Cafe Stresemann across the street, which has good breakfast options and a charming, interwar German atmosphere. The location of this hotel can't be beat. It is a short walk to the section of the wall still standing (near Checkpoint Charlie), the Wall Museum, Potsdamer Platz, and even Unter Den Linden is an easy walk. The Anhalter Banhof S station is across the street, and the U-bahn Kochstrasse is also very close. Buses M-41 and M-29 also pass right by the hotel. The hotel does not offer free wireless internet in the rooms, though. It wasn't an issue for me, but I overheard the front desk person say to a guest that it was about 8 Euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh not the best”
Reviews.Author: PLDC
Reviews.Content: It was pretty nice having a subway and bus stop across the street from the hotel and I was a bit hesitant from what I read in the other posts about the neighborhood being bad but its not so bad really. Its only my first day here but as a travel agent and a frequent traveler I am very disappointed by this Accor hotel. When I arrived I was greeted by a nice staff however she told me that they only had a room with one bed and a sofa that I could put a pillow on and sleep. The only two bed room was a handicap bedroom and it didn't really have a shower because it is a shower head and a curtain, there is no shower wall, the water goes on the bathroom floor. The bathroom has holes in the door so you can see... and smell.. everything that people are doing inside the bathroom. The worst part is that for the second ''bed'' that they give you .. they gave me a bag with sheets and pillows so that I can make the bed myself. Even at the hostel I stayed at they made the beds for me, what kind of service is that? When I get to the room I review their different rooms and the room they originally told me about was not just a sofa, it was a sofa BED.. something she told me it was not. I asked but she said no, its just a sofa for the second person in the room. I called 5 minutes after I checked in to switch rooms and they said it was not possible anymore and seemed pretty annoyed by my call. I am not sure what happed in 5 minutes but Im confident that no one checked in becuase the hotel was dead.. ehh at least its clean, but service isnt good at all and breakfast is €13 and internet is €7 per half hour. We will see how tomorrow goes I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel! Awful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dannyl87
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible! Our stay began with walking into someone else's hotel room . . . TWICE! We were given the keys to a room that was occupied. when we went down to reception we were given another occupied room! it was very embarrassing! The host did not even seem slightly apologetic!!! I would never stay here again. Location is not good either!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a longer break”
Reviews.Author: darrenmcc
Reviews.Content: Third stay here and will definitely give repeat business. Reception staff were all great, very friendly and chatty - got checked in within about two minutes, no fuss. Room was up high with a great view of Anhalter Bhf, very clean and tidy. Kitchenette is a great money-saver on restaurants. TV has been replaced with a widescreen flat-panel, but no Suite Box yet - this will just add to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place..”
Reviews.Author: backtoback
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms under the special rate, which meant that we could not amend or cancel our booking and we had to pay upfront by credit card. This we thought was fine as we saw no reason to cancel. However, one of the travellers with us missed his flight and so we only needed one room. Upon check in I explained this (11pm by the way) to the man who saw to us. He tried to book us in, but had problems - I think he was new. So a more senior worker came to assist. Firstly she told us that we had not paid, only reserved the rooms with my card and then tried to have a go at me for not cancelling the second room earlier so she could have sold it on. However, one minute later she discovered that we had actually paid for the room and whether we had one or two rooms was neither here nor there as they were both paid for. She was not the most friendliest of people and her customer service skills leave alot to be desired! However, on a more positive note we really loved our room, it was spacious, nicely decorated and had everything (plus more) for a weekend break. We never saw that lady again, and all the staff afterwards were helpful and friendly (especially when I got blisters from walking for 14 hours!!) We never ate the breakfast at the hotel after reading about and then seeing the odd way it was served. We ate at the Stresemann cafe across the road, which was much cheaper and lovely! Location of the hotel is great! 700m to Potsdamer Platz and a 5min walk to Checkpoint Charlie. Nice addition - a chocolate Santa was placed on our door on the saturday as it was Niklaustag. Overall, if youre in town for the weeked, want to be central, want somewhere reasonably cheap without having to resort to a hostel then this place is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: eurogaltng
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel and really liked it. The location was great. The S-bahn stop is really close. Potsdamer Platz is a 10-15 mintue walk. The hotel was nice and clean and modern. We had a room for 4 people and it was huge. A big bathroom, seperate toilet, small kitchen area with fridge and microwave. We had control over the heating in our room which is also a plus. It had everything we needed for our stay. We will definatly stay here again the next time we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Would def stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Dub26
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Suitehotel for 4 nights and found it great value for money. The rooms were huge and very comfortable. The room was a double but 3/4 people could have stayed there! I have to say the breakfasts were a little strange, with it being served in plastic containers. At 12 euro each, we decided to give it a miss! There's a restaurant directly across the road which does a nicer breakfast for less. The Italian just at the corner is fantastic and def worth a visit! The service was good, and there's free WiFi in the lobby. Only downside was that the rooms were unbelievably hot. There was no air con and if we opened the windows we heard everything from the streets below. Overall, I can't wait to come back to Berlin and I will definitely be staying in the Suitehotel again. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice! nice quality/price ratio and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: I went to Berlin for some work conferences and decided to stay for the weekend with a bunch of friends... We decided to book on Suitehotel since they had previously stayed here...
